statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Saunders hits go-ahead shot; Harvard beats Columbia 72-68
article.headline: Saunders hits go-ahead shot; Harvard beats Columbia 72-68
article.linkText: Saunders hits go-ahead shot; Harvard beats Columbia 72-68
article.story: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. -- Wesley Saunders hit a go-ahead shot with 2.9 seconds left to lift Harvard over Columbia 72-68 on Friday night. Jonah Travis gave Harvard a 68-62 lead with 3:46 left. Later, Columbia's Maodo Lo and Jeff Coby hit back-to-back 3-pointers to tie it at 68 with eight seconds left. Saunders finished with 18 points, 16 coming in the first half, for Harvard (17-5, 7-1 Ivy League). Siyani Chambers had 16 and Steve Moundou-Missi 14. Harvard led by as many as 19 points in the first half and held a 48-31 advantage at the break. Lo scored 22 points for Columbia (11-11, 3-5) on 8-of-16 shooting. Kyle Castlin had 13 and Cory Osetkowski 11. The Lions scored the opening basket of the game but never led again. Columbia went on an 11-0 run, with six points by Lo, to cut its deficit to 49-45 early in the second half.
